intro: Cunila lythrifolia, commonly known as sweet cicely, is a flowering plant native to Europe and parts of Asia. It belongs to the Apiaceae family, which includes parsley, carrots, and dill, and is characterized by its umbrella-like flower clusters. The plant features finely divided, aromatic leaves and produces small, white to pale pink flowers. Its roots and leaves are often used in culinary and medicinal applications due to their mild, licorice-like flavor. Cunila lythrifolia thrives in moist, well-drained soils and prefers full sun to partial shade.
